title: TAIT ICE: failed to resolve instance for `<Foo as Into<Foo>>::into`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=489cee58a05897d1e0d167b8591622a8 ```Rust #![feature(type_alias_impl_trait)] type T = impl Sized; struct Foo; impl Into for Foo { fn into(self) -> T { Foo } } fn main() { let _: T = Foo.into(); } ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/instance.rs:413:18: failed to resolve instance for >::into thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/3b2073f0762cff4d3d625bb10017e0ce4e7abe50/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1650:9 note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.72.0-nightly (3b2073f07 2023-06-17) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [collect_and_partition_mono_items] collect_and_partition_mono_items end of query stack error: could not compile `playground` (bin "playground") ```
Backtrace
